snippet: The Republican committee in the hometown of Senator Roy J. McDonald, who dismissed the fallout from his vote with “take the job and shove it,” endorsed a different candidate.
abstract: New York State Sen Roy J McDonald, Republican from Saratoga who supported same-sex marriage in 2011, is shunned in his hometown of Wilton, where the local Republican committee endorses one of his potential opponents in his re-election bid; McDonald is the second of four Republican senators who supported same-sex marriage to face direct political consequences as state lawmakers prepare to face voters.
lead_paragraph: The Republican committee in the hometown of Senator Roy J. McDonald, who dismissed the fallout from his vote with “take the job and shove it,” endorsed a different candidate.
